title: GLaDOS Vel'Koz
body:
I understand that Vel is male and GLaDOS is female, at least in robot terms, but WE NEED TO MAKE THIS WORK.

Maybe the rift is a portal? Alternating orange/blue?

Of course there's gonna be some sort of copyright thing with Valve so its probably not happening but i just had to put it out there.

replies.body: Or, or, we just stick Wheatley in the center. :o

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8Z6d7g4g,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-05-07T16:55:44.051+0000)
>
> Or, or, we just stick Wheatley in the center. :o

Red reply!!!! Yay!

Wouldn't that make Vel'Koz dumber (intelligence) tho?
That would be funny... if it weren't so sad...

> [{quoted}](name=abcdl44,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8Z6d7g4g,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2015-05-08T04:01:27.601+0000)
>
> That would be funny... if it weren't so sad...

Oh, my god.
I JUST GOT THIS.
IT TOOK ME TWO MONTHS TO GET THIS.
Better idea: GLaDOS Orianna with a Wheatley Ball.

> [{quoted}](name=Eathechicken,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8Z6d7g4g,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-07T18:05:41.832+0000)
>
> Better idea: GLaDOS Orianna with a Wheatley Ball.

I do like this idea.

Yes. All of the yes.

Real talk, though: how feasible would it be to do a partnership with other studios and do crossover content? For example, Valve teamed up with Bethesda to create the Space Core mod in Skyrim, and even the iBlitzcrank skin was done to celebrate the porting of League to Mac. How likely would it be for Riot to team up with another game company and make skins based on copyrighted content? There would be a huge amount of content to draw from, and the joint popularity of League, champions and other gaming icons would almost certainly guarantee great returns for everyone involved, players and creators alike.

> [{quoted}](name=Teridax68,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8Z6d7g4g,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-05-07T20:46:06.671+0000)
>
> Yes. All of the yes.
> 
> Real talk, though: how feasible would it be to do a partnership with other studios and do crossover content? For example, Valve teamed up with Bethesda to create the Space Core mod in Skyrim, and even the iBlitzcrank skin was done to celebrate the porting of League to Mac. How likely would it be for Riot to team up with another game company and make skins based on copyrighted content? There would be a huge amount of content to draw from, and the joint popularity of League, champions and other gaming icons would almost certainly guarantee great returns for everyone involved, players and creators alike.

Doubt it'll happen with Valve, just since they are pretty much direct competition in terms of League to Dota.
Though it'd be cool if they did a Dota costume/skin based on league champs and League got some Dota/other Valve property skins.
